title: Just some food for thought on making the ranked system less flawed
body:
What about, if a player goes afk or is reported by his team (overwhelming majority)  for afking the team receives 50%  less LP loss but the player who does go afk gets an added penalty from his teams LP loss.

Also. How does riot possibly think it is fair that just because you are in promos means u cannot dodge? How do you figure that if i can already tell my team is flaming each other or we have a whole bunch of terrible trolled picks that i must play the game knowing full well 90% of the time, we will lose.

Just seems that you can put so much time and effort into these games and really get beaten down on a personal level by the strain the game has.
Just some food for thought 
Aus Dave

replies.body: league of legends is that, a game. Unless you're going pro, which i doubt - don't let it affect you on a personal level ^.>

Would people stop suggesting loss prevention/LP loss reduction? It would not work and will never be implemented. (Unless they include LP gain reduction in afk games as well, which the community would blow up over - because when you win a game with an enemy afk, you 100% deserved that win, right?)
and your thought of not being able to dodge in a promo. cause i dont see a fault in that.

I've seen two people queue up at the same time at a low traffic time of night, and get placed on opposite teams in the same game. So if this is possible, then it's definitely exploitable in promos - people could dodge until they get placed against their friends on opposite teams.
Because the whole point is to be punished for every rule break with no exception, making it so you are less likely to WANT to break the rules.
